channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1128; 05:13PM; 2401 E Sepulveda Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3I7tM1I; #Wilmington; It took 34 LAFD firefighters, with automatic aid from LA Co FD, 53 minutes to extinguish heavy fire in a one-story commercial building (not the site of a previous burn, but immediately adjacent to a previous burn). Firefighters set up heavy streams, including ladder pipes, to drown this fire from the exterior of the building, which sustained extensive damage. No reported injuries. The cause of the fire is under investigation.; FS 38; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC6 E112 E233 E238 E285 E36 RA85 T33 T38 T85; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#1128; 04:20PM; 2401 E Sepulveda Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3I7tM1I; #Wilmington; Approx 50 x 100 single-story commercial structure with heavy fire showing (site of a previous burn. Defensive mode.; FS 38; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC6 E238 E285 E36 RA85 T38 T85; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

CONTAINED Brush Fire; INC#1261; 05:34PM; 4390 E Multnomah St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3pDpZmw; #ElSereno; The first 18 firefighters to arrive got a quick jump on the advancing fire, and have now stopped forward progress (in 25 minutes) at approximately 1/4-acre total size. No reported injuries. ; FS 16; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 14; AR1 BC1 BC2 E16 E201 E202 E212 E25 E290 E4 E47 EM11 H0D H2 H3 H7 HA2 HA3 HA7 T1 T12 T2 T90; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Brush Fire; INC#1261; 05:09PM; 4346 E Multnomah St; MAP: https://bit.ly/42yAea6; #ElSereno; LAFD crews are on scene of a brush fire, approximately 1/4 of an acre burning.; FS 16; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC2 E16 E201 E202 E212 E25 E290 E4 E47 EM11 H0D H7 HA7 T1 T12 T2 T90; CH5; 13; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0920; 01:46PM; 1460 N Ricardo St; MAP: https://bit.ly/44YECkz; #BoyleHeights; It took 37 firefighters 17 minutes to extinguish flames inside of a one-story home. Two people were home at the time, but no one was found to be injured. The cause of the fire is under investigation.; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; AR1 AR21 BC2 E1 E16 E2 E201 E202 E4 EM1 PH1 RA1 RA2 RA3 RA801 SQ21 T1 T2; CH7; 14; Nicholas Prange

Hiker Rescue; INC#0871; 01:00PM; 3376 Mesa Dr; MAP: https://bit.ly/3O5GCkH; #Chatsworth; One elderly female was injured (non-life-threatening) in a remote location near Chatsworth Park South Recreation Area and unable to return on her own. LAFD Air Operations hoisted her and transported to a local hospital via air. Nothing further.; FS 96; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; AO1 AO2 BC15 E106 E296 H0A H5 H7 RA96 RH114 T96; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0920; 01:29PM; 1460 N Ricardo St; MAP: https://bit.ly/44YECkz; #BoyleHeights; One-story single-family home with heavy smoke showing. Offensive mode.; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC2 E1 E16 E2 E201 E202 RA1 RA2 RA801 SQ21 T1 T2; CH9; 14; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0296; 07:05AM; 2706 W Wilshire Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3I2uddP; #Westlake; The first 30 firefighters located a contents fire in a two-story commercial building and extinguished the flames in 13 minutes, containing the fire to one small room. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 11; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 10; BC1 BC11 CM20 CM22 E11 E13 E20 E211 E220 E229 E29 E6 EM11 RA11 RA6 RA811 SQ21 T11 T20 T29; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0296; 06:52AM; 637 S La Fayette Park Pl; MAP: https://bit.ly/42jtTiN; #Westlake; Two-story commercial with moderate smoke showing from the first floor. Offensive mode.; FS 11; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 10; BC1 BC11 CM20 CM22 E11 E13 E20 E211 E229 E29 E6 EM11 RA11 RA6 RA811 SQ21 T11 T20 T29; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

Update Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#0470; 09:38AM; 1165 N Berendo St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3LPUZqB; #EastHollywood; 46 Firefighters took just 19 minutes of offensive firefighting operations to access, confine and fully extinguish heavy fire within a vacant, fenced and boarded 1,306 square foot one-story home (built 1919) filled and surrounded with debris, that was well involved with fire on their arrival. Flames were confined to the structure of fire origin, as well as vegetation to the rear. A comprehensive search of the debris filled structure discovered no injured persons. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 35; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC11 BC5 CM20 CM22 E20 E220 E227 E235 E35 E52 E6 EM5 RA35 RA52 RA835 T20 T27 T35; CH9; 14; Brian Humphrey
